description: Retrieves a certificate from your private CA or one that has been shared with you.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: An attacker could write a script that continiously calls GetCertificate to get all certificates
Using GetCertificate, adversaries can discover details about the cloud infrastructure, including how certificates are managed and issued within the environment.
Often times victim information is present in the certificate, f.e. email adresses.
Often times certificates are issued for single cloud services.
One could label the ACMPCA as a cloud storage, because the certificates are stored in there.

The GetCertificate API call retrieves certificates from a private CA or one that has been shared, which can then be used to authenticate access to various cloud services. Adversaries can use these certificates to authenticate themselves to cloud services remotely, leveraging the trust established by the certificate. This enables the adversary to move laterally within the cloud environment, access additional resources, or establish persistence by maintaining authenticated sessions with the compromised certificates
Certificates can be exploited to gain credential access, especially if they include sensitive authentication details
Certificates retrieved can be used in Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacks to intercept and decrypt secure communications.
Certificates are often used as an authetication material, especially in enterprise environments and can be therefore used to move laterally.
